docs.title: Welcome to the JujubaSVG documentation! 👋
docs.text:
jujubaSVG is a user-friendly library for handling SVG files in Android and Flutter applications. It enables granular manipulation of SVG elements - you can access any element by its ID to modify properties like background color, stroke, and other attributes.

Take a look at our repository.

docs.title: Available Commands 📐
docs.text:
jujubaSVG already provides some commands. This page we will demonstrate how to use them in Kotlin and Dart (Flutter).

Support added - Android v1.3.0 / Flutter v1.1.0

docs.title: Custom command
docs.text:
If you need to specify a custom command that is not provided by jujubaSVG, you can use CustomCommand.

// KOTLIN
jujubaCommander.execute(
    Command.CustomCommand(
        jsCode = "yourJSCode"
    )
)

// DART
commander.execute(
    CustomCommand(
        jsCode: 'yourJSCode'
    ),
);

docs.title: Update background color
docs.text:
Update the background color of a node. For example:

// KOTLIN
jujubaCommander.execute(
    Command.UpdateBackgroundColor(
        id = nodeInfo.id,
        color = getRainbowColor()
    )
)

// DART
commander.execute(
    UpdateBackgroundColor(
        id: nodeInfo.id, 
        colorHex: getRainbowColorInHex()
    ),
);

docs.title: Update stroke color
docs.text:
Update the stroke color of a node.

// KOTLIN
jujubaCommander.execute(
    Command.UpdateStrokeColor(
        id = nodeInfo.id,
        color = getRainbowColor()
    )
)

// DART
commander.execute(
    UpdateStrokeColor(
        id: nodeInfo.id, 
        colorHex: getRainbowColorInHex(),
    ),
);

docs.title: Update stroke width
docs.text:
Update the stroke width of a node.

// KOTLIN
jujubaCommander.execute(
    Command.UpdateStrokeWidth(
        id = nodeInfo.id,
        widthInPx = 20
    )
)

// DART
commander.execute(
    UpdateStrokeWidth(
        id: nodeInfo.id, 
        widthInPx: 20,
    ),
);

docs.title: Remove a node
docs.text:
Remove a node.

// KOTLIN
jujubaCommander.execute(
    Command.RemoveNode(
        id = nodeInfo.id
    )
)

// DART
commander.execute(
    RemoveNode(
        id: nodeInfo.id,
    )
);

docs.title: Update root background color
docs.text:
Update the root background color.

// KOTLIN
jujubaCommander.execute(
    Command.UpdateRootBackgroundColor(
        color = Color.White
    )
)

// DART
commander.execute(
    UpdateRootBackgroundColor(
        colorInHex: '#FFFFFF',
    ),
);

docs.title: Add Rounded Image
docs.text:
Add a rounded image into the same parent of the elementId.

// KOTLIN
jujubaCommander.execute(
    AddRoundedImage(
        elementId = nodeInfo.id,
        imageId = "imageId",
        imageUrl = "https://i.imgur.com/LQIsf.jpeg",
        widthInPx = 56,
        heightInPx = 56,
        coordinate = NodeCoordinate(0f, 120f)
    )
)

// DART
commander.execute(
    AddRoundedImage(
        elementId: nodeInfo.id,
        imageId: 'imageId',
        imageUrl: 'https://i.imgur.com/LQIsf.jpeg',
        widthInPx: 56,
        heightInPx: 56,
        coordinate: NodeCoordinate(
            x: 0.0,
            y: 120.0,
        ),
    ),
);

docs.title: Contributions 🤝
docs.text:
We encourage contributions of all types! Whether it’s reporting issues, suggesting new features, or submitting pull requests, you’re welcome to help improve the plugin.

  • Check out the issues page for ideas.
  • Feel free to submit pull requests.

docs.title: Some tips
docs.text: • If you have any questions about contributions, feel free to reach out to someone from CodandoTV. You can contact Gabriel Moro or Rodrigo Vianna.

docs.title: 1. Add the Dependency
docs.text:
You need to add the following line in your desired module/build.gradle.kts:

implementation("io.github.codandotv:jujubaSVG:<library version>")

Make sure your application has internet permission. This is required to run javascript commands:

// AndroidManifest.xml
<uses-permission android:name="android.permission.INTERNET" />

docs.title: 2. Define your Commander
docs.text:
You need to define at the top level of your composable function the commander (a friend that will help you to send commands to the library):

@Composable
fun YourComposable() {
    val jujubaCommander = rememberJujubaCommander()
    // ...
}

docs.title: 3. Declare the Widget to render the SVG
docs.text:
Now you need to declare the Widget responsible to render the SVG file:

@Composable
fun YourComposable() {
    val jujubaCommander = rememberJujubaCommander()

    JujubaSVG(
        svgText = svgText,
        onElementClick = { nodeInfo ->
            println("NodeInfo $nodeInfo")
            coroutineScope.launch {
                // commander sample
                jujubaCommander.execute(
                    Command.RemoveNode(
                        nodeInfo.id
                    )
                )
            }
        },
        commander = jujubaCommander,
    )
}

Don’t forget:

  • svgText should contain all content of your SVG file.

–

Any problems you are facing, any suggestions you want to add, please feel free to reach us out.

docs.title: 1. Add the Dependency
docs.text:
You need to add jujuba_svg library in your pubspec.yaml:

dependencies:
  jujuba_svg: ^1.0.0

For Android, make sure your application has internet permission. This is required to run javascript commands.

// AndroidManifest.xml
<uses-permission android:name="android.permission.INTERNET" />

docs.title: 2. Define your Commander
docs.text:
Let’s say you want to use the library in your my_beatiful_screen.dart. You need to initialize the controller:

class MyBeautifulScreen extends StatelessWidget {
  final JujubaCommander commander = JujubaCommander();

//...

docs.title: 3. Declare the Widget to render the SVG
docs.text:
The library provides a widget called JujubaSVGWidget, there you can the commander, svgText, and onElementClick.

  • commander: allow you to send commands to manipulate the SVG;

  • svgText: your SVG;

  • onElementClick: callback to intercept click events in your SVG.

class MyBeautifulScreen extends StatelessWidget {
  //...

  @override
  Widget build(BuildContext context) {
    return Scaffold(
        body: JujubaSVGWidget(
            commander: commander,
            svgText: svgText,
            onElementClick: (nodeInfo) => {},
        ),
    )
  // ...

Don’t forget:

  • svgText should contain all content of your SVG file.
